unit_learning_outcomes.description: Identify, define and analyse contemporary issues in money and finance.
Critique the academic literature, striving for alternative and creative ways of thinking in financial markets, and in business and policy environments.
Demonstrate a capacity to work independently, including the ability to research, form arguments, and write professionally proficient short-discussion pieces.

enrolment_rules.description: 50cp at 1000 level or above including ECON110 or ECON111 or ECON1020

assessments.description: There will be two online quizzes and two online discussions, each worth 2.5%.
A two-hour closed book exam, consisting of true/false, short-answer, and essay-type questions, will be held during the University Examination Period.
A two-hour online examination (open book) will be held during the University Examination period.
The format of the 60 minute class test will be a combination of true/false questions with explanation, and short-answer questions.
The assignment will contain a number of discussion/explanation questions based on the provided articles.
Every week, students are required to post their response to the discussion question in iLearn.
One-hour test will be held in week 7

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.description: In order to provide students with a deep understanding of the nature of money, the role and characteristics of financial markets, along with the instruments and institutions that inhabit them, this unit examines the evolution of money and finance from pre-history until the present. Although the workings of the Australian financial system are explored, the unit has a very global focus. Topics may include: the meaning and nature of money; interest rate determination and the yield curve; central banking and the actions of monetary authorities; the innovations of behavioural finance and crypto-currencies; in-depth analyses of money markets, bond markets, equity markets, and derivatives markets. All these topics are examined both in terms of theoretical foundations and in contemporary practical applications. The central theme of the unit is that innovation in money and finance has been as important as innovation anywhere else in shaping the modern world.
data.title: Money and Finance
